definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: Alexei Karenin:Thou shall not covet thy neighbor's wife.
sentences.chinese: 不可貪圖你鄰居的妻子。

sentences.english: He bartered away his pride for material gain.
sentences.chinese: 他爲貪圖物質財富而出賣了他的自尊心。

sentences.english: But his sons did not walk in his ways. They turned aside after dishonest gain and accepted bribes and perverted justice.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子不行他的道，貪圖財利，收受賄賂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
sentences.chinese: 他兒子不行他的道，貪圖財利，收受賄賂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: The richer people are, the greedier they are for money.
sentences.chinese: 人們越是富有越是貪圖錢財。

sentences.english: He had no forwardly idea or desire for enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有上進的理想，也沒有貪圖享受的奢望。

sentences.english: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
sentences.chinese: 不要貪圖虛名，彼此惹氣，互相嫉妒。

sentences.english: 33I have not coveted anyone's silver or gold or clothing.
sentences.chinese: 我未曾貪圖一個人的金，銀，衣服。

sentences.english: Dease the other exercises and use breath awareness to stop your mind wandering.
sentences.chinese: 遏制其它操練，用感知呼吸來遏制癡心貪圖。

sentences.english: He said Britain had become a "nation of grazers" seeking instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 他說，英國已成爲貪圖一時之快的“大胃王國”。

sentences.english: His life was devoted to the pleasure of the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 他一生貪圖肉體上的舒適享受。

sentences.english: Please do not spend your youth avoiding hardship and taking the path of least resistance .
sentences.chinese: 年青的時候不要逃避辛苦，也不要貪圖安逸。

sentences.english: Before your action, you must think about the consequence. Can't covet the temporarily delight, or the future trouble one by one.
sentences.chinese: 行動要考慮後果，不要貪圖一時的痛快，遺患無窮。

sentences.english: Youth means the predominance of courage over timidity, of adventure over the love of ease.
sentences.chinese: 青春意味着勇氣勝過膽怯，冒險犯難勝過貪圖安逸。

sentences.english: She bargained away her freedom for a little comfort.
sentences.chinese: 她貪圖一點舒適而犧牲了自由。

sentences.english: I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.
sentences.chinese: 我未曾貪圖一個人的金，銀，衣服。

definition: to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to be greedy in getting money
to challenge the law (idiom)/to knowingly violate the law
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
